q1.title: What is an ecosystem?
answers: A single species and its environment
A community of living organisms and their physical environment interacting as a system
A collection of plants only
A geographic area without human influence

q2.title: Which of the following is an example of an ecosystem?
answers: A desert
A single tree
A computer network
A car engine

q3.title: What does biodiversity contribute to the resilience of an ecosystem?
answers: It makes the ecosystem more susceptible to diseases
It decreases the ecosystem's ability to recover from disturbances
It increases the ecosystem's adaptability and ability to recover from disturbances
It has no impact on the ecosystem's resilience

q4.title: How are aquatic ecosystems different from terrestrial ecosystems?
answers: Aquatic ecosystems do not support life
Terrestrial ecosystems are predominantly water-based
Aquatic ecosystems are based in water environments, while terrestrial ecosystems are land-based
Terrestrial ecosystems have higher biodiversity

q5.title: Why is ecosystem diversity important for human survival?
answers: It provides recreational spaces only
It is not important for human survival
It supports a variety of services like water purification, pollination, and climate regulation that humans rely on
It only contributes to pharmaceutical discoveries

q1.title: What is an endemic species?
answers: A species that is found everywhere in the world
A species that is not native to a specific location
A species that is found only in one geographic location
A species introduced by humans to a new area

q2.title: What role do keystone species play in an ecosystem?
answers: They have minimal impact on the ecosystem's structure
They are the most abundant species in an ecosystem
They play a critical role in maintaining the structure of an ecosystem
They are always the top predators

q3.title: Why is species diversity crucial in agriculture?
answers: It reduces the need for chemical fertilizers
It increases dependency on a single crop variety
It helps in pest control and crop pollination, enhancing yield and food security
It only enhances aesthetic value

q4.title: What happens to an ecosystem when a species goes extinct?
answers: The ecosystem becomes more stable
It can lead to a chain reaction affecting other species and the ecosystem's balance
Extinctions have no impact on ecosystems
The biodiversity of the ecosystem increases

q5.title: What is the significance of genetic diversity within a species?
answers: It makes all individuals identical, reducing competition
It decreases the species' adaptability to environmental changes
It increases the species' resilience to diseases and changing environmental conditions
It has no real significance

q1.title: How does genetic diversity occur within a species?
answers: Through cloning
Through uniform habitat conditions
Through mutations, sexual reproduction, and gene flow
By reducing the population size

q2.title: Why is genetic diversity important for crop plants?
answers: It ensures all crops are genetically identical
It reduces the variety of crops
It enhances resistance to pests and diseases and can improve crop yields
It is only important for ornamental purposes

q3.title: How can conservation efforts enhance genetic diversity?
answers: By promoting inbreeding
By creating isolated populations
By preserving and restoring habitats and promoting species' natural reproductive processes
By reducing the number of species in a habitat

q4.title: What impact does genetic diversity have on a population's ability to adapt to environmental changes?
answers: No impact, as environments do not change
Decreases adaptability as it leads to more uniformity
Increases adaptability by providing a pool of genetic variations that may confer advantages under new conditions
Genetic diversity only affects physical appearance, not adaptability

q5.title: In conservation, what is a genetic bottleneck?
answers: A process where a population's size increases rapidly
A situation where a population's genetic diversity increases suddenly
A process where a population's size is severely reduced, leading to a loss of genetic variation
A method to increase genetic diversity through selective breeding

q1.title: What is the main goal of wildlife conservation?
answers: To increase human interaction with wildlife
To ensure the survival of species and the ecosystems they inhabit
To domesticate wild species
To utilize all natural resources for human benefit

q2.title: How do protected areas like national parks contribute to biodiversity conservation?
answers: By allowing unrestricted human development
By preserving habitats and providing sanctuaries for species
By promoting the extraction of natural resources
By encouraging the introduction of invasive species

q3.title: What role does the Convention on Biological Diversity play in biodiversity conservation?
answers: It discourages international cooperation on environmental issues
It promotes the sharing of resources regardless of conservation status
It provides a global framework for conserving and sustainably using biodiversity
It focuses solely on the conservation of commercially valuable species

q4.title: Why is habitat restoration important for conservation?
answers: It decreases land available for agriculture
It typically leads to an increase in invasive species
It helps to rebuild ecosystems and supports the recovery of species populations
It is only important for aesthetic and recreational purposes

q5.title: How does the concept of an ecological corridor benefit biodiversity?
answers: By restricting animal movement to limited areas
By promoting genetic uniformity
By connecting isolated habitats, allowing for gene flow and species migration
By increasing the use of land for agricultural purposes
